channel.title: Deep Learning on Columbia DSI Scholars
channel.description: Recent content in Deep Learning on Columbia DSI Scholars

item.title: Project: Real time observation and navigation of multitude of autonomous cars, in dense urban traffic intersections with many pedestrians
item.description: Project components: (i) Monitoring of traffic intersections, using birdâ€™s eye cameras, supported by ultra-low latency computational/communications hubs; (ii) Simultaneous video-based tracking of cars and pedestrians, and prediction of movement based on long-term observations of the intersection; (iii) Real-time computational processing, using deep learning, utilizing GPUs, in support of ii; (iv) Sub-10ms latency communication between all vehicles and the computational/communication hub, to be used in support of autonomous vehicle navigation.

item.title: Project: Real-time brain state classification
item.description: Using machine learning to conduct brain state classification at real-time on EEG/fNIRS/fMRI data.
